sentences.english: When young and frivolous feel there is nothing, there will be efforts to results.
sentences.chinese: 年少轻狂的时候觉得事在人为，努力就一定会有结果。

sentences.english: But I believe that, since we are young, we need a.
sentences.chinese: 但我相信，我们既然年少了，就需要轻狂一番。

sentences.english: Judgments are prepared for scorners: and striking hammers for the bodies of fools.
sentences.chinese: 体刑是为轻狂人而设，鞭笞是为愚人背而备。

sentences.english: Later, only know that they too would like to only extremely frivolous.
sentences.chinese: 后来，才知道，自己想的只是太过于轻狂。

sentences.english: I have those dreams you say, there is the young and frivolous, have become imagination.
sentences.chinese: 我对你说的那些梦想，还有那年少轻狂，都成了想像。

sentences.english: I'm a bit crazy, and a bit different.
sentences.chinese: 我有些轻狂，有些与众不同。

sentences.english: It seems to me to show an abominable sort of conceited independence.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得她给人一种自以为是的轻狂，令人厌恶。

sentences.english: So when you ride through the ruts, don't complicate your mind.
sentences.chinese: 当你告别了年少轻狂的岁月，别让你的思想复杂化。

sentences.english: Life grind our young frivolous edges and corners, we grow. Time urged.
sentences.chinese: 生活磨掉我们年少轻狂的棱角，时间督促我们成长。

definition: to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
not to know the immensity of heaven and earth/an exaggerated opinion of one's own abilities
pinyin: bu4 zhi1 tian1 gao1 di4 hou4
